title.narrative: (906.3) GENDER BASED VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE

description.narrative: Girls, women and other vulnerable groups' safety, dignity and right to care, and protection from gender-based violence are realized in the European Migrant and Refugee Response, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ALL MIGRANT AND REFUGEE CHILDREN , UASC or with their families, benefit from timely, equitable, quality access to services to guarantee their protection, care, development and social inclusion in ITALY (2018-2019)

sector.narrative: Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls, women and other vulnerable groups? safety, dignity and right to care, and protection from gender-based violence are realizedin the European Migrant and Refugee Response

description.narrative: UNICEF provided prevention and response;services to almost 1300 GBV survivors and individuals at risk;in Rome, Sicily, Calabria, and at border areas. UNICEF ensured that women and girls accessed reliable information on GBV risks and services, reaching over;20,000 people. UNICEF increased the capacity of more than 900 key stakeholders in providing support to GBV survivors, both with in-person training and remotely. Knowledge on key issues affecting refugee and migrant women and girls was generated, while input was provided to key policy documents such as the National Plan on Male Violence Against Women.;The inter-agency GBV coordination system was strengthened, particularly with UNHCR. | Status:Met | As-of Date:09/03/2022
